paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper primarily discusses BRCA1 variants and their classification discrepancies across Norwegian hospitals. Only one BRCA2 variant is mentioned in the context of a misclassification incident.

variants.additional_notes: The variant was misclassified as pathogenic by one hospital, leading to unnecessary surgeries.
key_quotes: Recently, an example of misinterpretation was unveiled in a hospital in Norway, where twenty-one female carriers had their breast and/or ovaries removed by prophylactic surgery without sufficient evidence that their variant, BRCA2 (NM_000059.3) c.68–7 T > A, was pathogenic.

challenges: The paper primarily focuses on BRCA1, with limited information on BRCA2 variants.
extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as only one BRCA2 variant was mentioned in the context of a misclassification incident.
